page.title: 03GARAGE
page.content: {WINESTEAD GARAGE} Known as Winestead Garage, it stands in Patrington, the boundary being very close by. It was built in 1970 on land in front of Fasco Buildings which was the former site of a brick kiln when the brickworks were in being and originally only sold petrol. The present owners purchased it in 1983 and have since then added a workshop, modern M.O.T. bay, a shop selling tobacco, sweets and car spares, a showroom, car hire facilities and employs six people. In 1984 they bacame agents for Ford cars. In 1985 a Ford Fiesta Popular 950 costs Â£4,258.73 on the road. A Granada Scorpio costs Â£15,810.00 on the road. Roberts Petrol is sold costing 198.7 pence per gallon or 43.7pence per litre for 4 star petrol.
